review: I snagged this when amazon was having a $20 special. We have two of the Fire TV's which we bought for $84 each. This is basically the same thing if you don't care about storage. We just have these for Netflix, Prime, etc. Our kitchen TV doesn't have a cable drop, so this was perfect for me to watch Netflix, HBO, etc. while cooking. Very happy with it.
author: J. Elliott

review: Wifi is weak on this product... Right next to router (with the power adapter plugged in) and constantly looses connection.
author: Jason Torrence

review: Awesome!! Better than Chromecast, no need to have your tablet or phone. All Apps are loaded into the Fire Stick. No lag on Wi-Fi, love the many options available in terms of movie/tv apps. Easy set up and not necessary to use power adapter if your TV has a USB always powered.
author: Gnmorpheus

review: Easy to install, easy to use.  Very fast!!  Love it!!
author: Linda C.

review: Easy setup. Amazon account was already entered. Be careful if giving as a gift since it is shipped tied to your account.The stick loads menus and content quickly.  The user interface is easy to understand and navigate.  If you have Prime, it is a great purchase. The included remote is a nice size and has decent range. This was something I missed with Chromecast.
author: John F.

review: My main streaming machine is my upper mid-range Sony BD, and I also have a Roku 3 on my other TV, and a Chromecast.  I got the Fire Stick during the two-day sale because "I gots to know."  Performance-wise, it actually does a better job of streaming than my Sony, especially on Amazon Video.  The only drawback for me, as with other Amazon products, is that it can't do Vudu.  But I'm actually keeping it plugged into my main TV because of the better performance of Fire on networks it can handle.  I'm impressed enough to spring for a Fire box when time to upgrade.  Definitely recommend.
author: Jon D "Combat journalist, media consultant, goatherd"
